question: Consider the following statements:
Statement(I): The set of all solutions of the linear inequalities $3x+8<17$ and $2x+8\ge12$ are $x<3$ and $x\ge2$ respectively.
Statement(II): The common set of solutions of linear inequalities $3x+8<17$ and $2x+8\ge12$ is (2, 3)
Which of the following is true?
choices: Statement (I) is true but statement (II) is false
Statement (I) is false but statement (II) is true
explanation: Common solution is intersection of $x < 3$ and $x \ge 2$. This is $[2, 3)$.
Statement II says $(2, 3)$ which excludes 2. Thus Statement II is false.
